hypothesis_content.title: Negative News + Neutral Regime → Asymmetric Put Buying Amplification
hypothesis_content.statement: In NEUTRAL regimes (confidence 55-70%), when significant negative macro news hits (e.g., 'scarier macro catalyst' headlines), the increase in BTC put/call ratio (25-delta, 7-day) will be amplified by 40-60% compared to the same news in BULL/BEAR regimes, creating overpriced puts for short-term volatility selling.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes lack conviction; traders over-insure against breakdowns. Negative news triggers amplified hedge buying versus trending regimes where positions are already set. This creates rich puts as fear overshoots actual price movement.
entry_conditions: Major negative macro headline (Gradient News Score < -0.7)
Deribit BTC put/call ratio (25-delta 7-day) increases >20% within 2 hours of headline
Spot price remains within 2% of pre-news level

exit_conditions.take_profit: Put/call ratio reverts 50% toward pre-news level OR 3 days pass
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Spot price breaks >4% below pre-news level (justified put buying)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Put/call ratio increase is <15% or spot breaks down severely (>5%) invalidating 'overreaction' thesis.
